citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was one animal with a health condition requiring treatment in accordance with the Program of Veterinary Care or
consultation with the attending veterinarian. A chicken in Pen 9 had an area of feather loss approximately 3 inches x 1
inch on the left side toward the rump. The facility had not observed the condition and had not provided any treatment.
Feather loss can be caused by many factors including infections, poor nutrition, stress, boredom, bullying, and feather
pulling. Failure to observe and treat health conditions in the animals can lead to a worsening of the condition.
The licensee must complete daily observations to assess the health and well-being of animals to allow for timely and
accurate information to be conveyed to the attending veterinarian on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
